Class 32

Jan 30, 2018 - Tue

View On Github Download class file

simple file uploading in php

enctype

When we upload file we have to set a enctype="multipart/form-data" attribute to form tag.

<form action="" method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">

to create a folder in php

mkdir('foldername')

to check any file or folder exists we use file_exists function. which will return boolean

//file
file_exists('hello.txt')
//folder
file_exists('hello')

to upload file in php we use move_uploaded_file function. Which takes 2 arguments. file and destination location.

  move_uploaded_file($tmp_name, $destination);

Uploading code in at a glance

<?php
if (isset($_FILES['file'])) {
  $file = $_FILES['file'];
  $name = $file['name'];
  $tmp_name = $file['tmp_name'];
  if (! file_exists('hello')) {
    mkdir('hello');
  }
  $destination = 'hello/' . $name;
  move_uploaded_file($tmp_name, $destination);
}

file uploading in php conditionally

in_array()

To check whether value exists in array or not

$fruit = ['apple', 'orange', 'banana', 'mango'];
in_array('apple', $fruit); // true
in_array('jackfruit', $fruit); // false

end()

It will extract last value from array

$array = ['dhaka', 'chittagong', 'borishal', 'feni'];
end($array) // feni

explode()

It will explode string into array

$string = 'apple, orange, banana';
explode(',', $string); // ['apple', 'orange', 'banana']

implode()

It will implode array into string

$array = ['apple', 'orange', 'banana'];
implode(',', $array); //  'apple, orange, banana'

all php code for conditional file upload in php

$message = '';

if (isset($_FILES['image'])) {
  $file = $_FILES['image'];
  $name = $file['name']; //arafat.jpg
  $exploded_name = explode('.', $name); // ['arafat', 'jpg'];
  $extension = end($exploded_name); //jpg
  $source = $file['tmp_name'];
  $supported_extensions = ['jpg', 'png', 'jpeg', 'gif'];
  if (in_array($extension, $supported_extensions)) {
    move_uploaded_file($source, 'hello/'.$name);
    $message = 'your picture uploaded successfully';
  }else {
    $message = 'Please upload only image file';
  }
}

Global scope and local scope

php has 3 scope for variable. Today I have demonstrated 3 scope

  • local
  • global
  • static

If we declare a variable outside function it will be global scope. Inside function declaring a variable call local scope.

$city = 'city variable outside function' ; // global scope
function test() {
  $hello = 'hello variable inside function'; // local scope
  echo $city; // I can't access $city variable since $city is outside function. I mean $city variable in global scopa      
}

How can we access global scope inside function

using global keyword or $GLOBALS super global we can access global scoped variable locally

$city = 'city variable outside function' ; // global scope
function test() {
  $hello = 'hello variable inside function'; // local scope
  global $city;
  echo $city; // Here I can access $city variable since earlier line I have added global keyword 
  echo $GLOBALS['city']  // Using super global we can access $city variable     
}

Search with php mysql

Sql query for search is

select * from table_name where column_name like '%your_query_word%'

So we will make a form with name q. which can be accessed by $_GET super global. Initially we will fetch all data from database but if user search for something we will filtering query by user search keyword

html part

<input type="text" name="q" class="form-control" placeholder="search here .....">
<button type="submit" class="input-group-append btn btn-primary">Search</button>

php part

<?php 

$con = new PDO('mysql:host=localhost;dbname=search', 'root', '');

if (isset($_GET['q'])) {
  $q = $_GET['q'];
  $statement = $con->prepare("select * from people where name like :name or email like :email");
  $statement->execute([
    ':name' => '%'.$q.'%',
    ':email' => '%'.$q.'%',
  ]);
} else {
  $statement = $con->prepare('select * from people');
  $statement->execute();
}

$people = $statement->fetchAll(PDO::FETCH_OBJ);
 ?>
